The Elder Soṇa and Koḷivisa’s Birth Story
“For the sage Anomadassī,
the world’s chief, the one of great strength,
I made a plaster of lime,
and I had a walking path made.🔽I spread the walking path

analyzed: nānā vaṇṇehi pupphehi  caṅkamam santharim aha
translated: with flowers of various colors,
and I made a canopy in the sky
and fed the supreme Buddha.
I raised my joined palms,🔽and after worshipping the one with good feet,
I dedicated the long house
to the Fortunate One at that time.🔽The Teacher, the unsurpassed one in the world,
knowing my thought,
the Fortunate One, the one with vision,
accepted (the offering) out of compassion.
The Buddha, the one who should be worshipped
by the world and the gods,
after sitting down in the Community of monks,
spoke these verses:
‘He who with a delighted mind
gave me the long house,
I will proclaim him,
listen to me as I speak.
When his time in the cycle of rebirths has ended,
endowed with meritorious deeds,
a chariot yoked with a thousand (horses)
will appear to him.
By that vehicle this person,
will go to the deva world;
The gods will rejoice,
when she has attained a fortunate rebirth.🔽We will dwell in a most excellent,
most valuable, priceless,
magnificent mansion,
we will dwell in the middle of it.
For twenty-three thousand aeons,
she will delight in the deva world;
for twenty-five aeons,

translated: she will be a king of the devas.
Seventy-seven times she will be a wheel-turning monarch;
all of them will have the same name, Yasodharā.
Having experienced two kinds of success,
having increased her store of merit;
in the eighty-eighth aeon,
she will be a wheel-turning monarch.
There too we will dwell in an excellent,
magnificent city, built by Vissakamma;🔽that city will be ten leagues in extent,
we will dwell in the middle of it.
After an immeasurable aeon,
a powerful lord of the earth,
named Okkāka,
will be a king in the country.
Among sixteen thousand wives,
she will be the most excellent of all;
born noble, a khattiya lady,
she will give birth to nine sons.
After giving birth to nine children,
the Khattiya woman will die;
And a dear young girl,
will do a great service.
After pleasing the crow,🔽the girl will receive a boon;
Having received the boon, the girl
will have her sons go forth.
And all of them, when gone forth,
will go to the supreme city;
Fearing a division in the clan,
they will live with their sisters.
And one girl will be afflicted

Energetic, intent,

When the rain had fallen, four inches deep,
and the grass in the courtyard was not stirred by the wind,
having stood there, intent on meditation,
there was no further shore to be reached.
I am tamed, tamed by the supreme tamer,
my mind is well-directed;
I have put down the burden,
I am extinguished, without pollutants.
The great nāga Aṅgīrasa,
born, a lion,
sitting in the Community of monks,
placed me in the foremost position.
The four analytical insights,
I have done what the Buddha asked.”🔽Thus did the venerable elder Soṇa Koḷivisa recite these verses.
